results.title: Slaughterhouse five
results.creator_credit: Paul Monash, Universal Pictures and George Roy Hill
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Kurt Vonnegut, an American P.O.W. is slipping into mental illness. Now a suburban optometrist, he has space/time fantasies, shifting between his experiences as a POW, including the bombing of Dresden, his life on another planet and his actual life. Michael Sacks plays Billy Pilgrim in a film shot in Czechoslovakia and Minnesota, which captures the complexity of Vonnegut’s work, and the despair of mental illness

results.title: Slaughter at speed
results.brief_description: Shows some attempts to find solutions to the problem of death on the roads. The slaughter in cars, buses, trucks and other vehicles which move on the roads follow an hourly predictable pattern. Discusses American and British research in discovering what happens when a car crashes and how best to keep the people inside it alive - or to prevent the crash ever occurring.

results.title: Slate, Wyn and Me
results.creator_credit: Tom Burstall, Ukiyo Films and Don McLennan
results.brief_description: Having robbed a bank and killed a policeman, two brothers kidnap a girl who witnessed it all. Based on the novel, ” Slate and me and Blanche McBride” by Georgia Savage. Stars Sigrid Thornton, Simon Burke and Martin Sacks.

results.title: Sladke hry minuleho leta = Sweet games of last summer
results.brief_description:
This impressionistic adaptation of De Maupassant’s classic novel ‘Mouche’ about a laundress and her five suitors was made for Czech television. Slovak-born director Juraj Herz has a career in film and television that spans more than 35 years and 30 films, working mainly in Prague but also in Slovakia, Germany and France. Although he first came to prominence in the 1960s, his work stands apart from that of other Czech and Slovak New Wave directors in its willingness to cross genres and constitutes a dense exploration of the fantastic.

Credits: Director, Juraj Herz ; photography, Jozef Simoncic.
Cast: Jana Plichtova, Frantisek Velecky, Peter Debnar, Milan Lasica, Julius Satinsky and Lubor Zahon.

results.title: Slacker
results.brief_description: The “slacker” is post-baby boomer, post-Vietnam, post-Communism and post- punk. The “slacker” is looked upon by elder generations as lacking ambition and ignorant of responsibility. The “slacker” is the white-bread, educated and unemployable refuse of American society on a collision course with itself. This rivetting film rejects traditional Hollywood narrative conventions. Instead, seemingly random characters move in and out of the frame, and without ever losing its charm or its anarchic wit, this impressionistic film manages to convey much about the dysfunctional social arrangements governing contemporary America. However, this film does not patronise the “slacker generation”; instead it finds comedy and illumination in the obsessions of the young. A young, nerdy woman holds up a jar containing Madonna’s pap-smear samples and in that jar she finds grace. This externally low-budget experimental feature shows how courage, determination, imagination and sheer will can result in an innovative film, that for all its money and power, Hollywood cannot hope to emulate. “Slacker” is a very, very cool film.

results.title: Skyhooks: the video collection
results.creator_credit: Musical Films, Ray Argall and Christina Pozzan
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Melbourne pop group ‘Skyhooks’ using video clips, concert footage, backstage interviews and segments from Australian television in the 70’s and 80’s. Formed in 1973, Skyhooks quickly acquired popularity amongst youths, while simultaneously arousing controversy in conservative Australia. This compilation tape presents 19 of their songs drawn from concerts, and video clips interspersed with television appearances, newspaper clippings and interviews.

results.title: Skyhook
results.brief_description: How the helicopter was used to set up a drilling rig at Sireru in a remote area of Papua. A whole oil camp was lifted piece by piece into the middle of the jungle by helicopter, thus solving one of the biggest problems, that of oil transportation, for in a country with a rainfall of up to 350 inches a year it may take three months to build a road.

results.title: Skyfall
results.creator_credit: Robby Susanto, Lu Gao and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Great collaboration between a 2D and 3D animator to create a composite of cutout animation styles. A series of landscapes are degraded by human activities, in a dreamlike meditation on the despoilment of nature.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
